data.text: Actually I’ll mention Titans too. The show is still solid, but we’ve had like 10 episodes to meet these characters and we really haven’t learned much. The show needs to focus more on the Titans and less on everybody else.

And lastly:
Mr. D is nothing special but it lost its charm a few seasons ago. I’m not too sad to see it go but it was a cool show for Canada and I’ll always appreciate its early seasons.
SNL has been pretty sucky this season. Weekend Update remains the best part.

Manifest is also really good so far. It’s got me hooked. I’m sure it’ll get a S2, but I hope the show can stay on a path of reasonablity and not follow in the path of other sci-fi shows that just get stupid as it drags on.

Blindspot is okay. Jane being Remi again is interesting but it’s certainly not fun to watch (because I feel bad for everyone lol). The team we came to love is split in several ways and I miss that unit. I never thought this show would make it to a S4, but they’re doing alright.

When they began, I thought Single Parents was way better than A Million Little Things but now I think the opposite. SP is kind of cute but all the kids are annoying and don’t act like real 7yos.
AMLT is sweet. A little dramatic but I found myself missing it when it was on hiatus.

The Good Place is still a unique show with great characters but the plot is just ??? and I can’t say this season is as good as S1.
Superstore is on par. I enjoy it, but not as much as I did when it began either. Is it just me? I feel like it’s just me.

Modern Family isn’t awful this season. It’s not hugely hilarious (it hasn’t been for a few seasons now) but Haley’s pregnancy is a good storyline, and I’m excited to see the show wrap up (properly, hopefully).

God Friended Me is probably my favourite new show. I’ve sung it’s praises here before. It’s just a light, cute show that I enjoy watching on Monday right after work (I miss it on Sunday nights because of curling). I hope it gets a S2.

This Is Us still has a good drama/lightness balance, but I haven’t been even close to crying yet.
Black Lightning isn’t thrilling me. It’s not awful but S2 just kind of started slow and boring.

The Arrowverse has been decent. Arrow and Supergirl, the two shows that disappointed me the most last year are actually holding their own this season. The Flash is on par. Legends, which I loved last year, is still the best but something about it isn’t impressing me this year.
